channel.title: CLOG :: Web Apps in Lisp: Know-how
channel.description: CLOG, the Common Lisp Omnificent GUI, follows a GUI paradigm for the web platform. You don’t write nested <div> tags, but you place elements on the page. It sends changes to the page you are working on through websockets, as you add or edit functionalities. We can see changes in real time. For example, change a colour: CLOG-USER> (setf (background-color *body*) :red) and BAM, it’s red. We can say the CLOG experience is mindblowing.
